Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: CHECK IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the drill check.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: DRILLING OPERATIONS CHECK SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set ofdrilling checks that may be mandated by an operating company, regulatory agency orcontract.
Column Comment.5: DRILLING CHECK TYPE: The type of check that is conducted, such as Daily WalkAround Inspection, H2S Signs Posted (if required), Well License and Stick DiagramPosted, Flare Lines Staked, BOP drills Performed, Visually inspect BOPs, FlarelinesandDegasser Lines. Must be used in combination with CHECK SET ID.
Column Comment.6: CONTRACTOR NAME: The name or initials of the contractor representative. Fillingin this column indicates that the contracator has initialed or signed the original wellcheck report.
Column Comment.7: CONTRACTOR REPRESENTATIVE BA ID: the identifier for the Business associatewho is representing the contractor for this check.
Column Comment.8: DEFICIENT INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating whether the check was passed orfailed.
Column Comment.9: DEFICIENT PERIOD: the period of time over which the drill check has been founddeficient.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.14: OPERATOR NAME: The name or initials of the operator representative. Filling in thiscolumn indicates that the operator representative has initialed or signed the originalwell check report.
Column Comment.15: OPERATOR REPRESENTATIVE BA ID: the identifier for the Business associatewho is representing the operator for this check.
Column Comment.16: PASSED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that the drill check was passed.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: RECORDED TIME: The time at which this condition was recorded.
Column Comment.19: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
